data.question: What is the Langmuir surface area of the metal-organic framework [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1) mentioned in the text?
What color change occurs to the solid [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1) upon dehydration?
data.answer: The color changes from yellow to pink upon dehydration.

data.question: What is the effect of rehydration on the dehydrated crystal of [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1')?
data.answer: Rehydration changes the color of the crystal back to yellow and retains its single-crystallinity.

data.question: How does the [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1) framework differentiate between phenol, pyridine, and benzene in isooctane?
data.answer: It differentiates them based on their ability to form hydrogen bonds with its carbonyl groups, which are exposed to the channels.

data.question: What is the guest-binding order for ethanol, phenol, pyridine, and benzene to the dehydrated host solid [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1')?
data.answer: The host binds guests in the order of ethanol > phenol > pyridine > benzene.

data.question: What structural feature of [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1) contributes to its permanent porosity?
data.answer: The structure contains linear polymer chains extending in three directions, linked by C-H–π interactions and hydrogen bonding, contributing to its permanent porosity.

data.question: What happens to the color of [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1) when it is dehydrated and then rehydrated?
data.answer: The color changes from yellow to pink upon dehydration and returns to yellow upon rehydration.

data.question: Considering the thermal stability of [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1), up to what temperature can it be heated without chemical decomposition?
data.answer: It is thermally stable up to 300°C without chemical decomposition.

data.question: How does the pore volume of [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1) compare to that of zeolites?
data.answer: The pore volume of [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1) is within the range of zeolites, indicating comparable porosity.

data.question: What role do the uncoordinated carbonyl oxygen atoms of bpydc2- ligand play in the structure of [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1)?
data.answer: They interact with the secondary amine group of the macrocycle to form a hydrogen-bonded six-membered ring, reinforcing the linear chain.

data.question: How does the H2 gas uptake of [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1) at 77 K and 1 atm compare to that of the best zeolite ZSM-5?
data.answer: The H2 gas uptake of [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1) is superior to that of the best zeolite ZSM-5.

data.question: What is the significance of the dihedral angle between pyridine and carboxylate planes in the bpydc2- unit of [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1)?
data.answer: The dihedral angle indicates the orientation of the bpydc2- ligand, which is almost perpendicular to the coordination plane of the macrocycle, affecting the structure's stability and porosity.

data.question: Does the [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1) framework retain its crystallinity during the reversible dehydration and rehydration processes?
Is [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1) soluble in water and common organic solvents?
Does the [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1) framework adsorb N2 gas but not H2 gas?
Is the color change from yellow to pink upon dehydration of [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1) irreversible?
Does the [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1) framework exhibit a rod-packing mode corresponding to the double network of threefold braids?
Is the guest-binding ability of the dehydrated host solid [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1') inferior to MOF-5?
Does the [Ni(cyclam)(bpydc)]·5 H2O (1) framework bind toluene in isooctane?
